Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Bleed air temperature exceedance. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Component fatigue due to operational stress cycles exceeding design limits
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pneumatic Starter component. Analysis
of operational data indicated parameter deviation.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Implement condition-based monitoring system
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Technical evaluation completed. Proposed preventive measures are appropriate and align with design intent.
